text: is a city in Aomori Prefecture, Japan. Hachinohe means "the 8th area" in north of Tohoku region from the Middle Ages era. There was "the places of 8th" for making horses for a war in Hachinohe. Hachinohe has a famous industrial area, and has a bigger fishing port more than most of other cities. There is a Tohoku Shinkansen station and the Tohoku Expressway in Hachinohe. The main industries in Hachinohe are manufacturing and services. Most of people in Hacnihohe work in manufacturing. In Hachinohe, the fishing industry is famous. Hachinohe brings in the most squid and saba in Japan. ==Geography== Two rivers run through Hachinohe. One is the Mabechi River, which runs from the south to the east, and flows into the Pacific Ocean. The other is the Nida River, which runs from the south to the north. ===Surrounding municipalities=== * Aomori Prefecture ** Gonohe ** Hashikami ** Nanbu ** Oirase * Iwate Prefecture ** Karumai ==Demography== According to Japanese census data,Hachinohe population statistics 1995 2000 2005 2010 2015 2020 249,358 248,608 244,700 237,615 231,257 223,415 ==References== ==Other websites== * Official website Category:Cities in Aomori Prefecture
title: Hachinohe
